summary: This bill, the National Plan for Epilepsy Act, mandates the Secretary of Health and Human Services to establish a National Plan for Epilepsy. This plan aims to coordinate research, improve diagnosis and treatment, and enhance the quality of life for individuals with epilepsy. It includes establishing an advisory council, conducting annual assessments, and requiring annual reports to Congress, focusing on federally funded efforts and recommendations for improved care, research, and data collection related to epilepsy. The bill sunsets on December 31, 2035.
